dialogue.text: In the kitchen, there was a typical morning scene for our house. Mom was deftly maneuvering between the kitchen table and the stove, preparing everything for our breakfast.

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: Finally, sleepyhead! Sit down and eat. The eggs are getting cold.
I lazily sat down at the table, my gaze shifting to my father, who was calmly sipping his coffee and reading the morning news.
Although it always seemed to me that he only held the newspaper so that no one would bother him early in the morning.
While I was gathering my thoughts, Mom had already finished preparing breakfast and sat down at the table.

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: You seem kind of... sluggish today, son. Were you up all night on your laptop again? How many times do I have to tell you, you need to sleep at night!

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Mom, don't start, I did sleep...
Sleepily poking at my eggs with a fork, I mechanically shoved them into my mouth.
After a couple of minutes of gastronomic manipulation, nothing remained of the former eggs except for yolk smeared across the plate.

dialogue.name: Mom
dialogue.text: Now that you've finished eating, hurry up and get ready for school, or you'll be late again.

dialogue.name: Dad
dialogue.text: That's right, listen to your mom, come on, soldier, march off to school.
